title: Things to do this weekend in Qatar ( May 29 – 31 , 2025 )
body_text:
CHAIRMAN: DR. KHALID BIN THANI AL THANI
EDITOR-IN-CHIEF: PROF. KHALID MUBARAK AL-SHAFI
Doha, Qatar: This weekend is the perfect opportunity to start preparing yourself for the upcoming Eid Al Adha, enjoy several musical offerings, watch a highly-anticipated football final, and more.
Tajheezat Eid Al Adha Trade Fair
Until June 5, 2025
Weekdays: 10am – 10pm; Fridays: 3pm – 10pm
Katara Cultural Village, South Side
Unique items ranging from jewellery to garments, incense, and much more are all available here. Take a trip to Katara and help make your preparations for Eid Al Adha.
Regency Outlet Exhibition
Until June 2, 2025
Weekdays: 10am – 10pm; Fridays: 1pm – 10pm
Regency Halls, D Ring Road
Regency Halls Outlet Exhibition promises the “biggest sales event of the season” with brands like Max, Baby Shop, Home Box, Lifestyle and more offering big discounts.
UCL Final Live Screening
May 31, 2025
10pm
Various venues
Novo cinemas across Qatar will host exclusive live screenings of the UEFA Champions League final match between Paris Saint-Germain and Inter Milan. Screenings will be held at 01 Mall, Doha Oasis, Centro, Mall of Qatar, Msheireb Galleria, Place Vendome, Souq Waqif, Tawar Mall, and The Pearl. Tickets here.
A Seat at the Table: Food & Feasting in the Islamic World
Until November 8, 2025
Weekdays: 9am – 7pm; Thursday: 9am–9pm; Friday: 1:30pm–7pm
Museum of Islamic Art (MIA)
A Seat at the Table: Food & Feasting in the Islamic World" at the Museum of Islamic Art (MIA). It is exploring the cultural role of food across the Islamic world and within Muslim traditions. Tickets here.
Doha Women Forum’s ‘The Art of Reinvention’
May 31, 2025
4pm
Al Aziziyah Boutique Hotel
A workshop and roundtable featuring remarkable women discussing strategies to revitalise, reinvent, and realign your leadership path with meaningful purpose. The workshop features trailblazing women such as executive & leadership coach Asmaa Al Kuwari, content creator Yezzi Navarro, and radio broadcaster Marwa Al Saleh, and podcast host Alexandria Wood-Ward as moderator. Register here.
Candlelight concert with Vivaldi and more
May 30, 2025
Two time-slots; 5:30pm and 7:30pm
Museum of Islamic Art Auditorium
Enjoy a magical performance of Vivaldi’s undoubted magnum opus, the Four Seasons violin concerti, under warm candlelight glow. Tickets here.
Al Shaqab Show Jumping League Final
May 29 – May 31, 2025
3pm – 5pm
Al Shaqab Longines Indoor Arena
Spectators arriving for the Al Shaqab Show Jumping League Final can expect, in addition to the charged sporting atmosphere,a range of family-friendly activities and exclusive hospitality experiences featuring a delectable assortment of food and beverage options. Entry is free. Ticket booking here.
Qatar Outlet Exhibition
May 28 – June 1, 2025
Weekdays: 10am – 10pm; Fridays: 3pm – 10pm
Hall 5, Doha Exhibition and Convention Center (DECC)
Qatar’s biggest outlet exhibition is back, with unbeatable collections across fashion, watches, tech, home, perfumes, travel gear and more.
Chopin’s Piano Concerto No. 2
May 31, 2025
7:30pm
Katara Opera House
The Qatar Philharmonic Orchestra (QPO) promises an evening of captivating music led by conductor Renchang Fu and featuring Eric Lu, winner of the prestigious Leeds International Piano Competition. The concert will begin with Chopin’s Piano Concerto No. 2, followed by the melodies of Dvořák’s Symphony No. 9 “From the New World.” Tickets here.
